channel.title: Blogs on Ashish Bende
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Ashish Bende

item.title: Rackspace
item.description: Rackspace Summer Internship I was an intern at Rackspace during the summer'16. I worked with the ObjectRocket team, a relatively small but dedicated team. I was tasked to develop an end-to-end data connector project for managed database service (MongoDB/Elasticsearch). A bit intermediating at the beginning, but I thoroughly enjoyed working on this feature. In a short span, I developed the connector which would consume real-time Twitter feeds and store them in either MongoDB or Elasticsearch instance.

item.title: Fujitsu
item.description: Fujitsu Network Communications At Fujitsu, I’m contributing to Virtuora-NC - an OpenDaylight based SDN controller. Over the years, I worked on different projects. Starting with the NorthBound, followed by MLPCE (where I spent most of my time) and, most recently, the Topology project. Virtuora NC Topology: A module that discovers physical network inventory and builds topology representation. Developing a physical topology visualization feature across different abstraction layers to pinpoint exact network alarm events.
